content:
Besides funding and infrastructure projects, many initiatives designed to support rural economic development in Ireland also offer various types of support, such as:

1. Training and Skills Development: Many initiatives offer training and skills development programs to help individuals learn the skills required to create and run successful businesses.

2. Business Networks and Support Structures: Business networks and support structures help individuals and businesses to connect with others in the same industry or region, share information, and collaborate on projects.

3. Mentoring and support services: Many initiatives offer mentoring and support services, providing individuals with guidance and support to help them grow their businesses.

4. Access to Markets: Several initiatives offer opportunities to connect with new markets, allowing businesses to expand and reach new customers.

5. Technical Support and Advice: Many initiatives provide technical support and advice, helping businesses to navigate complex regulations and procedures.

Overall, these different types of support and resources help to create a supportive environment for businesses and entrepreneurs in rural areas to grow and thrive.
